intro: Correa bicolor, commonly known as the pink and white correa, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its attractive, fragrant flowers that display a mix of pink and white hues. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is well-suited to coastal and sunny environments. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Correa bicolor is also valued for its ecological role, providing nectar for native pollinators.
